subjectDescription: Discover a full suite of online business courses that will allow you to make better business decisions and succeed in today's competitive business world. Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Building Brand Personality and Customer Loyalty
headline: This free online branding course explores the concept of brand personality and explains how it affects customer loyalty.
description: Customers show loyalty towards particular brands for a number of reasons. One reason could be that customers perceive a particular brand to have ‘human’ characteristics they can connect with. In this branding course, we explain how to evoke customer affection and loyalty towards your brand. We show you how to build a personal brand and promote it using the media. The course also demonstrates how to transform your business through rebranding.
courseDescription:
Why do people wait hours in line to purchase the newest iPhone? Or shell out top dollar for Nike Shoes? The psychology behind ‘brand personality’ is the answer. Your preference for certain brands is not random. These brands are engineered to appeal to you and others with similar desires. Forming deep connections to people's emotions is how major brands dominate their markets and gain loyal customers. This branding course explores strategies that you can use to build brand personality and thus evoke and sustain customer loyalty.

Our first section shows how using the media can influence brand visibility and explains why building a personal brand is important. We then define ‘brand authenticity’ and show you how to create a brand that is perceived as ‘authentic’ by potential customers. We lay out four key elements on which to focus your marketing efforts.

The course’s last section outlines practical steps you can take to deal with or handle customer service mistakes to let you win back your audience's trust. Finally, we explore the concept of rebranding and its ability to transform your business. This course is suited to anyone who wants to optimise their personal or business branding efforts and grow a loyal customer base or online presence. We draw on marketing principles and strategies and link them to branding practices to help you to establish a brand personality that inspires customer loyalty.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Identify ways to approach media outreach.
    • Outline the steps in building your personal brand.
    • Explain how brand authenticity affects customer loyalty.
    • Examine the steps to be taken when mishaps occur.
    • Outline the process involve in rebranding.

  • Using the Media to Promote Your Brand

  • While running a business, developing relationships with the media can be similar to dating. With so many options available, it's important to find the right fit. The most effective way to identify good media partners is through research.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Research is very necessary. A good place to begin is online.

    ​Finding the right media partners for your brand or business requires effort and attention to detail in order to find a good fit. 

    There are two main ways to approach media outreach: the vertical approach and the horizontal approach.

  • The Power of Personal Branding

  • In the world of pastry-making, there is a clear example of the power of personal branding. 

    Two companies, Pastries Inc. and Pastries by Martin, both produce delicious, buttery, flaky pastries that melt in your mouth. Both companies advertise the quality and taste of their products.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • However, Martin, the owner of Pastries by Martin, takes his personal branding a step further by using his personal blog, social media profiles, and speaking engagements to share his lifelong passion for food and his experiences growing up in France with a pastry chef mother and apprenticing under top Parisian chefs.

    He incorporates these personal anecdotes into his marketing efforts and consistently mentions and links these to his business, Pastries by Martin.
  • As a result of Martin's personal branding efforts, Pastries by Martin has become more successful than Pastries Inc. This is because Martin's personal branding helps customers emotionally connect with and trust his business.

  • Why Brands Need to Get Real

  • Boot Kraft, a new independent footwear company based in Eastern Germany, is seeking to attract new customers with their first-ever online ad campaign. 
    Despite producing handcrafted, high-quality boots and shoes, they struggle to differentiate themselves in a crowded market. To effectively promote their brand, they must find a way to stand out and appeal to their target audience.
  • Which aspects of Boot Kraft should they highlight to sell more products?

    1. Their exclusive hand-made products.
    2. Their proud German roots.
    3. The price range of their products.

    What do you think?

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • To create a strong connection with customers, Boot Kraft should focus on highlighting its unique qualities and identity, which will help it stand out in a crowded footwear market.  By emphasizing its handmade production process in Eastern Germany and the high quality of its boots and shoes, the company can differentiate itself from other businesses in the same industry. This will help customers feel more connected to the brand and more likely to choose Boot Kraft over its competitors.

  • How to Recover when Mishaps Occur

  • When a brand makes a mistake, it's important to not only fix the issue but also address it publicly and take steps to prevent similar issues in the future. Failing to address a mistake publicly can lead to a PR crisis, as customers may lose trust in the brand and its products. For example, Toy Store, a company that manufactures toys for kids, shipped hundreds of toys on Children's Day. When customers opened their boxes, they discovered that the toys were either broken or faulty. How should the brand respond to this problem? Response 1 or Response 2?

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

    Response 1

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

    Response 2
  • It would be best for Toy Store to make a response similar to Response 2. They should assume responsibility and respond in a timely, thoughtful and structured way to win back the trust of the public and their target customers.
